divs: Sighting DetailsI was turning on my sprinklers and noticed a strange light in the sky. It was an orange colored light similar to a flame. When I saw it I could not figure out what it was so I went inside to get my wife. She came out and said it was an airplane. As she said that the light dimmed and re-lit. I told her that airplanes don't do that. She then said that it must have gone behind a cloud. I told her that there were no clouds today. She then went inside. Living near Ontario Airport, I've seen many a plane go by, but this was not the same. I watched the object about 1 to two minutes more before it dimmed out. The object was moving at a very slow speed exactly parallel to the horizon and never descended or ascended. It fully dimmed and re-lit twice as I was watching it. At one point it stopped moving and hovered for about 5 seconds, then resumed it's path. After about 2 minutes, it dimmed fully. I then saw a black shadow of an object for about 1 second. My eyes were unable to find the object in the dark sky after that. I stayed out there another minute or two, but the object did not reappear. I then went inside. I have no pictures or video. I was just curious if anyone else saw it and reported it. That is the reason I am reporting it to you.
trends: There have been 8 other sightings in Rancho Cucamonga
There were no other sightings in Rancho Cucamonga on or around May 3rd 2011
Summary: Orange colored light traveling very slow in a southernly direction parallel to the horizon. Light pulsated twice then dimmed out to a black shadow. No clouds in the sky, light did not float downward. At one point it hovered for a couple of seconds.
